intro: Ginoria montana, commonly known as the mountain ginoria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically pink or purple and bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in temperate climates.
